title: Dirty Page behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved. The user needs to figure out how to save or discard their changes when prompted with the dialog 'Do you want to save the changes?'. The options are Yes, No, and Cancel. Yes would save the changes, No would discard the changes, and Cancel would do nothing and remain on the Source page. Additionally, the dialog is titled 'Error'.
OB: If you edit the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor, and then try to switch back to the Layout view, you will get an error message indicating that you need to save your changes. The problem is that the user has to figure out what they need to do to save the changes (or discard them, which is even harder), and the error message is not very clear. The error message is 'Source page is dirty.'
EB: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then switching back to the Layout view, the user should receive a clear error message indicating that they need to save their changes. The dialog should have an informative title and provide clear options to save, discard, or cancel the changes.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer editor and switch to the 'source' view of the Layout Editor.
2. Edit the XML.
3. Try to switch back to the Layout view.
4. Observe the error message that indicates the need to save the changes.
5. Verify that the dialog provides clear options to save, discard, or cancel the changes.
